intro: Aretia maxima, commonly known as the giant aretia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 10 centimeters in diameter. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a waxy texture. Aretia maxima is typically found growing in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments.
